triples.evidence: for real MRI coil design, we need precise optimization to make sure the fields are uniform and stable. That’s done through finite element analysis

evidence: FIGURE 4.25. (Left) The ideal current density needed to produce a spatially uniform B1 field across a sample placed in the cylindrical coil.

triples.evidence: When the current in one connecting wire flows in a particular direction, it generates a local magnetic field pointing downward. To produce a local field pointing upward, the current in the adjacent wire must flow in the opposite direction, forming a closed loop.
